actions-list.actionItem: The House adjourned. The next meeting is scheduled for 10:00 a.m. on February 25, 2025.
On motion to adjourn Agreed to by voice vote.
Mr. Haridopolos moved that the House do now adjourn.
The House has concluded all anticipated legislative business and has proceeded to Special Order speeches.
The House proceeded with further one minute speeches.
The House observed a moment of silence in remembrance of the Virginia Beach, Virginia, police officers killed in the line of duty.
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

actions-list.header: On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: (2/3 required): 384
actions-list.actionItem: 25 (Roll no. 45).
Considered as unfinished business. H.R. 818 — "To amend the Small Business Act to include requirements relating to new small business entrants in the scorecard program, and for other purposes."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

actions-list.header: On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: (2/3 required): 396
actions-list.actionItem: 15 (Roll no. 44).
Considered as unfinished business. H.R. 832 — "To clarify the primary functions and duties of the Office of Advocacy of the Small Business Administration, and for other purposes."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

actions-list.header: On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: (2/3 required): 405
actions-list.actionItem: 0 (Roll no. 43).

Considered as unfinished business. H.R. 825 — "To prohibit individuals convicted of defrauding the Government from receiving any assistance from the Small Business Administration, and for other purposes."
The Chair announced the unfinished business was the question on motions to suspend the rules which had been debated earlier and on which further proceedings had been postponed.
The House convened, returning from a recess continuing the legislative day of February 24.
The Speaker announced that the House do now recess. The next meeting is scheduled for 6:30 P.M. today.
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by voice vote.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 828.
Considered under suspension of the rules.

Mr. Williams (TX) moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill. H.R. 828 — "To require the Administrator of the Small Business Administration to report on the veterans interagency task force, to require the Comptroller General of the United States to report on access to credit for small business concerns owned and controlled by covered individuals, and for other purposes."

At the conclusion of debate, the Yeas and Nays were demanded and ordered. Pursuant to the provisions of clause 8, rule XX, the Chair announced that further proceedings on the motion would be postponed.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 804.
Considered under suspension of the rules.

Mr. Williams (TX) moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill. H.R. 804 — "To require the Administrator of the Small Business Administration to improve access to disaster assistance for individuals located in rural areas, and for other purposes."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by voice vote.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 754.
Considered under suspension of the rules.

Mr. Williams (TX) moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill. H.R. 754 — "To amend the Small Business Investment Act of 1958 to increase the amount that may be invested in small business investment companies."

At the conclusion of debate, the Yeas and Nays were demanded and ordered. Pursuant to the provisions of clause 8, rule XX, the Chair announced that further proceedings on the motion would be postponed.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 788.
Considered under suspension of the rules.

Mr. Williams (TX) moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill. H.R. 788 — "To provide for Department of Energy and Small Business Administration joint research and development activities, and for other purposes."

At the conclusion of debate, the Yeas and Nays were demanded and ordered. Pursuant to the provisions of clause 8, rule XX, the Chair announced that further proceedings on the motion would be postponed.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 818.
Considered under suspension of the rules.

Mr. Williams (TX) moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill. H.R. 818 — "To amend the Small Business Act to include requirements relating to new small business entrants in the scorecard program, and for other purposes."

At the conclusion of debate, the Yeas and Nays were demanded and ordered. Pursuant to the provisions of clause 8, rule XX, the Chair announced that further proceedings on the motion would be postponed.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 832.
Considered under suspension of the rules.

Mr. Williams (TX) moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill. H.R. 832 — "To clarify the primary functions and duties of the Office of Advocacy of the Small Business Administration, and for other purposes."

At the conclusion of debate, the Yeas and Nays were demanded and ordered. Pursuant to the provisions of clause 8, rule XX, the Chair announced that further proceedings on the motion would be postponed.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 825.
Considered under suspension of the rules.

Mr. Williams (TX) moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill. H.R. 825 — "To prohibit individuals convicted of defrauding the Government from receiving any assistance from the Small Business Administration, and for other purposes."
The Speaker announced that votes on suspensions, if ordered, will be postponed until a time to be announced.
The House convened, returning from a recess continuing the legislative day of February 24.
The Speaker announced that the House do now recess. The next meeting is subject to the call of the Chair.
The House proceeded with one minute speeches.
The Chair designated Mr. Thompson of PA to lead the Members in reciting the Pledge of Allegiance to the Flag.
The Speaker announced approval of the Journal.  Pursuant to clause 1, rule I, the Journal stands approved.
Today's prayer was offered by the House Chaplain, Chaplain Margaret Grun Kibben.
The House convened, returning from a recess continuing the legislative day of February 24.
The Speaker announced that the House do now recess. The next meeting is scheduled for 2:00 P.M. today.
The House proceeded with Morning-Hour Debate. At the conclusion of Morning-Hour, the House will recess until 2:00 p.m. for the start of legislative business.
The Speaker designated the Honorable Nicholas J. Begich III to act as Speaker pro tempore for today.
The House convened, starting a new legislative day.
